Event.name: Closure
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> manipulates a <fen>Fastener</fen> to open or close a <fen>Containing_object</fen> (e.g. coat, jar). Sometimes an <fen>Enclosed_region</fen> or a <fen>Container_portal</fen> may be expressed. Since the <fen>Manipulator</fen> is syntactically omissible, many verbs in this frame incorporate the <fen>Fastener</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Mary</fex> <t>closed</t> <fex name="Containing_object">her coat</fex> <fex name="Fastener">with a belt</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Mary</fex> <t>closed</t> <fex name="Containing_object">her coat</fex> <fex name="Manipulator">with one hand</fex>.</ex> <ex><fex name="Agent">Mary</fex> <t>buttoned</t> <fex name="Containing_object">her coat .</fex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_object
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the item that is closed by the agent with the fastener. <fex name="Agent">Lee</fex> <t>buttoned</t> <fex name="Containing_object">his coat</fex>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Agent opens/closes the Containing-object. <ex><fex name="Agent">Harry</fex> <t>uncorked</t> the champagne.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Fastener
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the fastener that the agent manipulates. <ex>Marcus <t>tied</t> his shoe <fex name="Fastener">with the neon-green shoelaces</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Enclosed_region
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the region enclosed by the container-object that is closed. <ex>Harry <t>buckled</t> his belt <fex name="Enclosed_region">around his ample waist</fex>.</ex> <ex>Jeremy <t>buttoned</t> the shirt <fex name="Enclosed_region">around her hypothermic body</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manipulator
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the instrument or part of the body that manipulates the Fastener. <ex>Lee <t>unbuckled</t> his belt <fex name="Manipulator">with one hand</fex>.</ex> Note that this FE is syntactically omissible.</def-root>

Arg.name: Container_portal
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the active zone of the container that may be expressed as the direct object of the target verb. <ex>We <t>zipped</t> <fex name="Container_portal">the tent flap</fex>.</ex> The sentence refers to the closure of the tent, hence is different from sentences where the action involves the manipulation of a fastener, e.g. We unscrewed the lid.</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Container_portal</fen>/<fen>Containing_object</fen> ends up closed.
<ex>Why did you only <t>lace</t> it up <fex name="Degr">partway</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the closure of the <fen>Containing_object</fen> or the <fen>Container_portal</fen>.
<ex>He <t>sealed</t> the lid <fex name="Ins">with wax</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the closing event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Agent</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An action of the <fen>Agent</fen> that accomplishes the closure of the <fen>Container_portal</fen> or <fen>Containing_object</fen>.
<ex>He had to <t>button</t> his sleeve <fex name="Mns">by holding the cuff in his mouth</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location where the closing event takes place.
<ex>Shouldn't you have <t>buttoned</t> that <fex name="Place">in the bathroom</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Agent</fen> closes the <fen>Container_portal</fen> or the <fen>Containing_object</fen>.
<ex>They <t>close</t> the bank vault <fex name="Time">at precisely 5:35PM</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The resultant state of the Closure action. </def-root>

Arg.name: Beneficiary
Arg.definition: <def-root>The person for whom the Closure event occurs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the Closure event and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE describes a participant of the state of affairs introduced by the target as being in some state during the action. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: button.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. 1. fasten or be fastened with buttons.

lexUnit.name: open.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: undo or remove the cover or fastening of.

lexUnit.name: close.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. bring two parts of (something) together.

lexUnit.name: buckle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. fasten or decorate with a buckle.

lexUnit.name: cap.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: a.put or form a lid or cover on.

lexUnit.name: zip.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. fasten with a zip.

lexUnit.name: lace.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fasten or be fastened with a lace or laces.

lexUnit.name: unbuckle.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. unfasten the buckle of.

lexUnit.name: uncork.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: pull the cork out of

lexUnit.name: seal.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: to fasten or close securely

lexUnit.name: fasten.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: close or do up securely

lexUnit.name: unfasten.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: with obj. open the fastening of; undo.

lexUnit.name: tie.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: (of shoes or clothing) form a knot in the laces of in order to close.
